channel.title: Node Driver on Harvester manual test cases
channel.description: Recent content in Node Driver on Harvester manual test cases

item.title: Add a custom "Docker Install URL"
item.description:
1. add a harvester node template
  2. Refer to the “Test Data” value setting.
  3. Use this template to create the corresponding cluster

Expected Results

  1. The status of the created cluster shows active
  2. the status of the corresponding vm on harvester active
  3. the information displayed on rancher and harvester matches the template configuration

Test Data

Harvester Node Template

HARVESTER OPTIONS

  • Account Access
  • Internal Harvester
  • Username:admin
  • Password:admin
  • Instance Options 
    CPUs:2                       Memorys:4
Disk:40                        Bus:Virtlo/SATA/SCSI
Image: openSUSE-Leap-15.3.x86_64-NoCloud.qcow2
Network Name: vlan1 SSH User: opensuse

item.title: Add cluster driver
item.description:
1. Cluster Management > Drivers > Node Drivers
  2. Click “Add Node driver”
  3. Add the correct configuration and save

Expected Results

  1. Created successfully, status is active

item.title: Add the different roles to the cluster
item.description:
1. Create three users user1, user2, user3
  2. Give the roles of Cluster Owner to user1, Create Project to user2 and Cluster Member to user3 respectively.
  3. Login with these three roles

Expected Results

item.title: Add/remove a node in the created harvester cluster
item.description:
1. add/remove a node in the created harvester cluster

Expected Results

  1. rancher on the cluster modified successfully
  2. harvester corresponding VM node added/removed successfully

item.title: Backup and restore of harvester cluster
item.description:
1. create a deployment in harvester cluster
  2. Go to the rancher’s cluster list and make a backup of the harvester cluster
  3. After the backup is complete, delete the deployment created in the harvester cluster
  4. go to the list of clusters in the rancher and restore the harvester cluster

Expected Results

item.title: Basic functional verification of Harvester cluster after creation
item.description:
1. create the project.
  2. deploy deployment

Expected Results

  1. The project is created successfully
  2. Deployment successfully deployed

item.title: Create a 3 nodes harvester cluster with RKE1 (only with mandatory info, other values stays with default)
item.description:
1. From the Rancher home page, click on Create
  2. Select RKE1 on the right and click on Harvester
  3. Enter a cluster name
  4. Give a prefix name for the VMs
  5. Increase count to 3 nodes
  6. Check etcd, Control Plane and Worker boxes
  7. Select or create a node template if needed
    • Click on Add node template
    • Create credentials by selecting your harvester cluster
    • Fill the instance option fields, pay attention to correctly write the default ssh user of the chosen image in the SSH user field
    • Give a name to the rancher template and click on Create
  8. Click on create to spin the cluster up

Expected Results

  1. The status of the created cluster shows active
  2. The status of the corresponding vm on harvester active
  3. The 3 nodes should be with the active status

item.title: Create a 3 nodes harvester cluster with RKE2 (only with mandatory info, other values stays with default)
item.description:
1. From the Rancher home page, click on Create
  2. Select RKE2 on the right and click on Harvester
  3. Create the credential to talk with the harvester provider
    • Select your harvester cluster (external or internal)
  4. Enter a cluster name
  5. Increase machine count to 3
  6. Fill the mandatory fields
    • Namespace
    • Image
    • Network
    • SSH User (default ssh user of the chosen image)
  7. Click on create to spin the cluster up

Expected Results

  1. The status of the created cluster shows active
  2. The status of the corresponding vm on harvester active
  3. The 3 nodes should be with the active status

item.title: Create a harvester cluster with 3 master nodes
item.description:
1. add a harvester node template
  2. Create harvester cluster count set to 3

Expected Results

  1. The status of the created cluster shows active
  2. show the 3 created node status running in harvester’s vm list
  3. the information displayed on rancher and harvester matches the template configuration

item.title: Create a harvester cluster with a non-default version of k8s
item.description:
1. Verify versions 1.19.10, 1.18.18, 1.17.17, 1.16.15 respectively

Expected Results

  1. k8s displayed on the UI is consistent with the created version (cluster list, host list)
  2. Use kubectl version to see that the version information is the same as the created version

item.title: Create a harvester cluster with different images
item.description:
1. d a harvester node template
  2. Set the image, it should be a drop-down list, refer to “Test Data” for other values
    • ubuntu-18.04-server-cloudimg-amd64.img
    • focal-server-cloudimg-amd64-disk-kvm.img
  3. Use this template to create the corresponding cluster

Expected Results

  1. The status of the created cluster shows active
  2. The status of the corresponding vm on harvester active
  3. The information displayed on rancher and harvester matches the template configuration
  4. The drop-down list of images in the harvester node template corresponds to the list of images in the harvester

Test Data

Harvester Node Template

HARVESTER OPTIONS

  • Account Access
  • Internal Harvester
  • Username:admin
  • Password:admin
  • Instance Options 
    CPUs:2                       Memorys:4
Disk:40                        Bus:Virtlo/SATA/SCSI

Network Name: vlan1 SSH User: opensuse

item.title: Deactivate/activate/delete Harvester Node Driver
item.description:
With Rancher < 2.6:

  1. Tools->Driver Management→Node Driver
  2. Deactivate/activate/delete Harvester Node Driver With Rancher 2.6:
  3. Cluster Management > Drivers > Node Drivers
  4. Deactivate/activate/delete Harvester Node Driver

Expected Results

  1. Harvester icon is not visible when creating a cluster / Harvester icon is visible when creating a cluster /Harvester icon is not visible when creating a cluster

item.title: Delete Cluster
item.description:
1. Delete Cluster

Expected Results

  1. successful cluster deletion in rancher
  2. the corresponding VM node in harvester is deleted successfully

item.title: Guest CSI Driver
item.description:
1. Start rancher using docker in a vm and start harvester in another
  2. Import harvester into rancher from “Virtualization Management” page
  3. On rancher, enable harvester node driver at “Cluster Management” -> “Drivers” -> “Node Driver”
  4. Go back to “Cluster Management” and create a rke2 cluster using Harvester
  5. Once the created cluster is active on the “Cluster Management” page, click on the “Explore”
  6. Go to “Workload” -> “Deployment” and “Create” a new deployment, during which in the page of “Storage”, click on “Add Volume” and select “Create Persistent Volume Claim” and select “Harvester” in the “Storage Class”
  7. Click “Create” to create the deployment
  8. Verify that on the Harvester side, a new volume is created.
  9. Delete the created deployment and then delete the created pvc. Verify on the harvester side that the newly created volume is also deleted. create another deployment, say nginx:latest with 8GB storage created as step 6.
  10. “Execute shell” into the deployment above and use “dd” command to test the read & write speed in the directory where the pvc is mounted:
    • dd if=/dev/zero of=tempfile bs=1M count=5120
    • dd if=/dev/null of=tempfile bs=1M count=5120
  11. SSH into a VM created on the bare metal and run the same dd command
    • dd if=/dev/zero of=tempfile bs=1M count=5120
    • dd if=/dev/null of=tempfile bs=1M count=5120
  12. Scale down the above deployment to 0 replica and resize the pvc to 15GB on the harvester side:
  13. Double check the pvc is resized on the longhorn side.

Expected Results

  1. The cluster should have similar storage speed performance
  2. The PVC should resize and show it in the Longhorn UI

item.title: Import External Harvester
item.description:
With Rancher < 2.6:

  1. Deploy the rancher and harvester clusters separately
  2. In the rancher, add a harvester node template
  3. Select “External Harvester”, and refer to “Test Data” for other value settings.
  4. Use this template to create the corresponding cluster With Rancher 2.6:
  5. Home page / Import Existing / Generic
  6. Add cluster name and click on Create
  7. Follow the registration steps

Expected Results

  1. The status of the created cluster shows active
  2. The status of the corresponding vm on harvester active
  3. The information displayed on rancher and harvester matches the template configuration

Test Data

Harvester Node Template

HARVESTER OPTIONS

  • Account Access
  • External Harvester
  • Host: Port: 443
  • Username:admin
  • Password:admin
  • Instance Options 
    CPUs:2                       Memorys:4
Disk:40                        Bus:Virtlo
Image: openSUSE-Leap-15.3.x86_64-NoCloud.qcow2
Network Name: vlan1 SSH User: opensuse

item.title: Import internal harvester
item.description:
1. enable harvester’s rancher-enabled setting
  2. Click the rancher button in the upper right corner to access the internal rancher
  3. add a harvester node template
  4. Select “Internal Harvester”, and refer to “Test Data” for other value settings.
  5. Use this template to create the corresponding cluster

Expected Results

  1. The status of the created cluster shows active
  2. the status of the corresponding vm on harvester active
  3. the information displayed on rancher and harvester matches the template configuration

item.title: Verify "Add Node Pool"
item.description:
1. Create a cluster of 3 nodes, One node with etcd, Control Plane, Worker, the other two with Worker
  2. The cluster is created successfully, use the command kubectl get node to view the node roles

Expected Results

  1. The status of the created cluster shows active
  2. show the 3 created node status running in harvester’s vm list
  3. the information displayed on rancher and harvester matches the template configuration
  4. Check that the node role is correct
